copy.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that is made to be exactly like another thing
copy.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Be sure to make copies of all the documents.
She forwarded them a copy of her British passport.
This chair is a copy of an original design.
copy.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: one of many books, magazines, records etc that are all exactly the same
copy.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The record sold a million copies.
Free copies are available on request.
We have six copies of the movie to give away.
a copy of the local newspaper
copy.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: something written in order to be printed in a newspaper, magazine, advertisement etc
copy.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Now that I’ve seen the finished copy, I’m delighted.
copy.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The rug is a copy of a fine Chinese carpet.
Make a copy of the letter before you send it.
Did you keep a copy of the email?
Could you send me a copy of the agreement?
I’m attaching a copy of the schedule.
The painting is a good copy of the original.
It is a close copy of a bronze figure found in Iceland.
Be sure you regularly make back-up copies of your data.
copy.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing
copy.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
To copy a file, press F3.
a design copied from an 18th-century wallpaper
The pupils just copy from textbooks and learn facts.
He copied the number into his notebook  (=wrote the same number there).
copy.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to deliberately do something that someone else has done or behave like someone else
copy.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Children often copy what they see on television.
I found myself copying him and his mannerisms.
copy.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to cheat in an examination, schoolwork etc by looking at someone else’s work and writing the same thing as they have
copy.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Jeremy had copied from the girl next to him.
copy.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing
You could copy the files onto a CD.
Many people have tried to copy his paintings.
to copy a piece of paper with writing or pictures on it, using a machine
I’ll photocopy the letter and give it to you.
to print a copy of a picture or document, especially in a book or newspaper
The image has been reproduced in many magazines and newspapers around the world.
to illegally copy something written or printed
to illegally copy and sell something such as a book, DVD, or computer program
The survey suggests that 27% of software in the UK has been pirated.
copy.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: one of many documents, books, magazines, computer software packages etc that are all exactly the same
copy.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: We are offering a free copy of Windows98 with all new PCs.
The book sold 24,000 copies in the first three months.
copy.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a letter, document etc that has been made to look exactly like another one, for example by being PHOTOCOPIED (=copied using a special machine called a photocopier)
copy.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Please send copies of all the relevant documents to me as soon as possible.
copy.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: written material that is to be printed in a newspaper, magazine etc
copy.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Our closing date for copy for the next issue is February 14.
copy.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: the written part of an advertisement
copy.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: “The business of fitness and good health is healthier than ever, ” or so says the advertising copy for the National Exhibition of Health & Leisure.
copy.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: a computer program, CD etc that has been made by putting information or music from another one onto a disk. It is illegal to sell copies made in this way
copy.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: selling pirated copies of computer games
copy.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: a file, DIRECTORY etc in which you have put all the same information as is in another one
copy.translation[2].definitions[5].examp: Before you run this software, you should make a copy of your autoexec.bat file.
copy.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to make a copy of a letter, document etc
copy.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Could you copy these letters before you send them out?
The letter was copied to the managing director.
copy.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to deliberately use an idea, design etc that legally belongs to someone else
copy.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: They have issued a patent infringement lawsuit accusing their rivals of copying their design for a range of ready meals.
copy.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to illegally make a copy of a computer program, CD, etc
copy.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: a new way to protect software from being copied
copy.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: to make a file, DIRECTORY, program etc that is exactly the same as another one so that you can use it if something happens to the original one
copy.translation[3].definitions[3].examp: The best way to save an email is to copy it to a file.
You can copy, delete, or tag files in a matter of seconds.
